Text.Page:
I search the continents for rare treasures, scouring ruins and shipwrecks for what time forgot.

By your shabby clothes, I can tell you haven't done much treasure hunting. You're in luck! I can teach you how!"Let's hear it."

The gula shipwrecks were once merchant shipsâ€”but even merchants have their secrets. Go onto the ship and search for anything out of place.

Just find the ship, then find the treasure! Never would have thought of that, huh?
(It's locked. Maybe one of the {@LinkCreature:31#14#drowned gula bosuns} has the key.)<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"Let's go, treasure chest."</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

See! I told you. For that I should get at least...two thirds of the treasure, I think. Yes, that seems fair!

Let's open it up!
Seek and you shall find. Done talking!

Huh. It's...a map.

I mean, look! A treasure map, no doubt! Yes, I'm sure it's a treasure map."Where does it lead?"

That...is not work for a genius explorer like myself. That's codebreaker work.

See? It just looks like gibberish until you get it deciphered.

Take it to Yasper at the Beacon Point Garrison. He's great at this sort of thing, being a junior explorer to myself.

A coded map? Let me see.

Where did you get this? It's not a treasure map. It's a piece of art."It's what?"

I mean it's old, and it looks like a map, but this "code" is gula writing. It's meant to be decorative.

It may be worth a little since it's so old, but only to the right collector. I'll buy it from you, if you're selling. What do you say?
